result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob B. Sniadajewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

timeConds.notes:
Huber for employment and counseling or treatment he may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Required to continue to day report to be sure he is in compliance with PTSP that he has been placed on so that he does not end up being revoked before he starts his jail sentences because of non-compliance. 
First half must be in jail with the second half on GPS monitoring if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration. 
Court finds there is sufficient pre-trial incarceration credit.  Parties are to submit a written stipulation with regards to jail credit.  
Must report today for start date.

records.addlTxt: Notes from Attorney for Defendant

Defendant Jacob B. Sniadajewski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF261, 14CF262, 14CF314, 14CF349, 14CF359, 14CF455, 15CF73, 15CF333, 15CF405, 15TR424, 15TR425
1:41 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF333 Counts 1 thru 3 - NO CONTEST
15CF73 Counts 1 thru 5 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF333 Counts 1 thru 3, 15CF73 Counts 1 thru 5.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Dismissed & Read-In: 
15CF405
14CF455
14CF359
14CF349 
14CF314
14CF262
14CF261
15TR424
15TR425

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF333 Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 4 years: 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment and then leave immediately thereafter. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All prescriptions from 1 pharmacy.
Sign necessary releases to monitor any controlled substances that might be prescribed.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if he has not had one in the past 12 months.  If he has, then he is to be in strict compliance with treatment recommendations and provide proof to his agent. 
Pay fine of $50 plus costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Provide a DNA sample if not already done so. 

15CF333 Count 2 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 4 years, concurrent with Count 1:
Comply with all conditions in Count 1. 
Pay fine of $50 plus costs including the DNA surcharge. 
 
15CF333 Count 3 - 
Serve 90 days jail. 
Consecutive to 15CF73 Count 4.
Huber for any employment, treatment or counseling that he may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Required to continue to day report to be sure he is in compliance with PTSP that he has been placed on so that he does not end up being revoked before he starts his jail sentences because of non-compliance. 
First half must be in jail with the second half on GPS monitoring if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration. 
Must report today for start date. 
Pay fine of $50 plus costs including the DNA surcharge.

15CF73 Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 4 years, concurrent with other probations he is on:
Comply with all conditions in 15CF333 Count 1. 
Pay fine of $50 plus costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CF73 Count 2 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 4 years, concurrent with other probations he is on:
Comply with all conditions in 15CF333 Count 1. 
Pay fine of $50 plus costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CF73 Count 3 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years, concurrent with other probations he is on:
Serve 45 days in jail. 
Huber for employment and counseling or treatment he may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Required to continue to day report to be sure he is in compliance with PTSP that he has been placed on so that he does not end up being revoked before he starts his jail sentences because of non-compliance. 
First half must be in jail with the second half on GPS monitoring if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration. 
Court finds there is sufficient pre-trial incarceration credit.  
Must report today for start date.  
Pay fine and costs totaling $3,214.00.
33 months revocation of license.
33 months IID. 
DOT Assessment must be completed and comply with all treatment recommendations. 

15CF73 Count 4 - 
Serve 270 days jail. 
Consecutive to 15CF73 Count 3. 
Huber for employment and any counseling or treatment he may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Required to continue to day report to be sure he is in compliance with PTSP that he has been placed on so that he does not end up being revoked before he starts his jail sentences because of non-compliance. 
First half must be in jail with the second half on GPS monitoring if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration. 
Must report today for start date. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CF73 Count 5 - 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

Attorneys to file stipulation with the court and the jail with regards to jail credit.

Pre-Trial Supervision Program Report
Status conference at 09-08-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Jacob B. Sniadajewski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard:  14CF261, 14CF262, 14CF314, 14CF349, 14CF359, 14CF455, 15CF73, 15TR424, 15TR425

10:45 a.m.  Court calls the cases
Atty Constable indicates she has revoked her plea offer as the defendant has new felony bail jumping charges.  There is an initial appearance on the new file for Monday at 1:30. 
Atty Drengler concurs.  Asks to move the initial appearance out for 1 week since he has a sentencing hearing in another county on that same day. 
BY THE COURT:  Given the change in circumstances, all files will track and be set for status conference on 9/8/15 at 1:30 p.m. in Br 3.  Bonds and conditions of bonds are continued.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
dated 8/5/15

Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court addressed the bond modification.  Stating the bond modification was that he is to report on Friday, Saturday and Sunday to Day report.
Attorney Drengler requested a bond modification for 3 weeks.  
ADA Constable replies to the court and does remember the modification of bond until the plea hearing later this month.  
Court will not take it up any further without the defendant present.
Attorney Drengler indicates that he will speak with is client further about the matter.
Court will not take the matter up any further.
Pre-Trial Supervision Program Report

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
If bond is posted, Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.
Comply with conditions in all other outstanding bonds.

7/29/15:  Bond is amended to Report alcohol and drug free on Friday, Saturday, Sunday and Monday.
Copy of letter from Atty Drengler with Courts reponse
Proof of Completion of Victim Impact Panel, Intensive Outpatient Treatment Program at Ministry Behavioral Health, and letters of support from the providers of those programs.

Defendant Jacob B. Sniadajewski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:47 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Set for a Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond.
Atty Drengler makes statements regarding the motion and states the modification on the record.
Court is requesting clarification from Atty Drengler as to where his client will be that he will not be able to meet is bond condition of checking in with Pre-Trial Supervision.
Atty Drengler makes statement to the Court.
10:52 a.m.  Defendant makes statement as to where he will be traveling for his business.
Atty Drengler states that his defendant is currently reporting 7 days per week for Day Report.
Court questions Atty Drengler regarding the bond money posted.
Court questions the number of files that this defendant has; Atty Constable makes statements that there are 6 files and provides a status of the cases.
Court questions the states position on this request; Atty Constable makes statements.  
Atty Constable will stipulate to the request of Atty Drengler and ask's that the Court accomodate the defendant.  Defendant is requesting August 1, 2 & 3 with no Day Report as per the State.
Atty Constable's concern is if the defendant will comply with his conditions.
Defendant states that Todd Kuhn has his certificate to show that he has completed the program with Ministry Health; Defendant states his aftercare program.
Defendant stated that he would be willing to go and get the certificate from Todd Kuhn.

BY THE COURT: 
Court will modify the bond conditionally.
Report alcohol and drug free on Friday, Saturday, Sunday and Monday. 
Court needs to see a copy of the certificate of completion for the intensive outpatient treatment program with the aftercare program recommendations.
Copy of Report from the Pre-Trial Supervision Program to be e-mailed to the Attorney's and the Judge - Atty Drengler to notify Pre-Trial Supervision Program that he will need a report from Day Report.
Bond will not be modified until these conditions have been met; Court does not want to grant the bond modification without knowing what has been occurring with the defendant.
Court will not approve the bond modification at this time.
for Modification of Bond

Matter is set for a bond modification hearing at this time.

3:08 p.m. Defendant Jacob B. Sniadajewski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Jacob B. Sniadajewski in custody. ADA Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Atty Drengler requests bond modification for a reduced cash bond or make payments.
ADA Constable makes statements in objection to bond modifications.
Court questions the history of the original case for all the bail jumping and are still pending.
BTC: Bond Modification is Denied.
Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 10, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Case is recalled at 2:08 p.m.  Defendant now appears from our jail.

Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a high cash bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant makes statements to the Court re: bond.
